availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William Hanks and Eliza Hanks. Married to Sarah F. Gillmore Hanks in Montgomery County, Kentucky, on May 20, 1858. Father to John W. Hanks, U. S. Hanks, and Andrew Hanks. Resident of Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 50B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 212.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Mudlick, pp. 21B-22A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994049, Montgomery County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Montgomery County Marriages, Film 000216835.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Montgomery County, KY, October 1863, p. 168.
